Hello thank you for your interest! The DTV lets you come in and out of Thailand freely for the next 5 years with a 6-month stay each time. âœ¨

For the DTV, you need to be able to prove both of the following:

1. Cash balance of THB 500,000 or foreign currency equivalent in any bank account in the world under your name

2. Proof of ONE of the following:

- remote employment
- freelance work
- medical appointments in Thailand
- enrollment in a 6-month Muay Thai or Thai culinary course

Are you able to provide the above? 

Please let us know your response below, and one of our team members will get back to you with more info.
No
We can only apply for your DTV if you are able to show a bank account with ending cash balance above THB 500,000 or foreign currency equivalent.

But if it helps we've had many applicants who successfully got their DTV even if the money was only transferred to their account a few days before we apply for the DTV. You can apply for the DTV when you're in Indonesia or Vietnam or Philippines as a tourist.
I am in thailand next month
I am Moroccan national

Yes

Great! If your family members are able to support your visa application with THB 500,000, you may be eligible for the 5-year Destination Thailand Visa (DTV)! We have a few packages available, based on which documents you can provide:
option 4
Great!

Here is the process:

1. You share all the required documents with us via the Issa Compass iPhone app or on Whatsapp / email if you use Android
2. We pre-check your documents and confirm youâ€™re good to go
3. You pay us the fee
4. You go to Indonesia / Vietnam / Philippines for about 2 weeks and we apply for the DTV on your behalf
5. We send you the approved visa and you come back to Thailand! For the next 5 years youâ€™ll get to stay for 180 days every time you re-enter Thailand!
If you use Android you can send your documents via email to contact@issacompass.com or on WhatsApp:
If you use an iPhone, you can start your application on our iPhone app and our legal team will review and prepare your application
https://apps.apple.com/app/issa-compass/id6544788009
How much charges of all this ?
The total price for the 5-year DTV is 16,050 THB\n\nThis fee already includes both the government fee, the service fee, and 7% VAT. Our service fee is only about 2,000 THB
Can show 500,000 bath cash as well ?
Because I do not have thai bank account  ?
Unfortunately, it has to be in a bank account.
However, it doesn't have to be a Thai bank account. It can be a bank account from any country as long as it has the amount equivalent to THB 500,000

How much is the visa? Only 300? In Pattaya I was quoted 100000baht,why u do for 300usd?
I do t have apple
Our fee include the government fee, visa fee, service fee and VAT!
Everything is included and you are unlikely to go to the embassy or immigration yourself. We will do everything on your behalf
If you can show 500,000 THB in your bank account you can choose one of the packages below and that will qualify you for the DTV:
These are our packages and the fee quoted according to the documents you can offer!!
Those courses are 6 months. What happens after 6 month?
You choose to continue the course or not, itâ€™s up to you. Because once you pay and are registered, the school will issue the documents for you to apply for the 5-year DTV.
If you use Android you can send your documents via email to contact@issacompass.com or on WhatsApp:
Which of the courses are you interested in? >.<
So after 6 months I have to enroll in another course?
Itâ€™s not mandatory to re-enroll, you can re-enroll if you enjoy the classes.
Because once you get the DTV, you get it for 5 years.
And there are no further checks?
There are no further checks or any problems with our previous applicants.
I'm not interested in cooking or boxing, are there other options?
If you are an owner of a company or you can provide proof of freelance or remote employment, then you can go with that too!
This is because the DTV, you can apply via the remote working route, medical route, or the soft power which is Thai cooking and Muay Thai.
Thank you. If I choose the cooking, what would be the complete cost for 5 years? Every 6 month I have to exit and come back and renew the stamp right?
To clarify, you would like to enroll for 5 years of cooking class?
Yes
No
But you said 6 month is enough. Then only 6 month
You need to exit and reenter Thailand once you reach 180 days, it can be same day exit and entry as well.
The price for the cooking class is 36,900 THB
Can I confirm, what is your nationality and where are you based at the moment? And are you currently holding any visas for Thailand?
And that's all the cost for 5 years? Any extra cost I will have? I'm German and I'm having a tourist visa and I'm in bkk
Visa exemption via airport

Yes, thatâ€™s all for the cost of the 5-year DTV. However, When we apply for your DTV, you'll need to be outside of Thailand. You can be in your home country or in Indonesia or Vietnam or Phillippines as a tourist and it will take about two weeks.
Yes I hear I can have 3 tourist visa per year, now I'm on my second

To apply for a married visa in Thailand, you have two options:

1. Individual Applications: Each spouse applies separately with a THB 500,000 bank balance each and their own qualifying activity.

2. Joint Family Application (Recommended): Apply together with one spouse as a dependent. You need a THB 1,000,000 bank balance (joint or primary account) and one set of activity documents. A marriage certificate is required.

The joint application is usually simpler and more cost-effective. If you have more questions or need assistance, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š
My girlfriend live in Thailand

To apply for a married visa while your girlfriend lives in Thailand, you will need to meet certain requirements. You can apply for a joint family application, which is often simpler. 

You will need a bank balance of THB 1,000,000 (either in a joint or primary account) and a marriage certificate to prove your relationship. 

If you have more questions or need assistance with the application process, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š

The 3-month visa requires a minimum bank balance of 20,000 THB and costs 4,000 THB. The 6-month visa requires a minimum bank balance of 40,000 THB and costs 9,000 THB.

How can I apply for visa

To apply for a visa to Thailand, follow these steps:

1. Gather all required documents. This includes your passport, photos, and any supporting documents related to your purpose of visit.
2. Upload your documents for review. You can do this through our platform.
3. Pay the necessary fees to finalize your submission.
4. If applying for a DTV visa, you must exit Thailand and apply from a supported country like Indonesia or Vietnam.
5. Once your application is submitted, the embassy will process it, which typically takes around 7 days.
6. After approval, you can re-enter Thailand.

If you need help with the application or have specific questions, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š

Which type visa I need

To stay in Thailand long term, you might consider the Destination Thailand Visa (DTV). This visa allows you to live and work in Thailand for five years. You can work for yourself or for companies outside of Thailand. 

To qualify, you need a minimum bank balance of 500,000 THB and must already be in Thailand on a valid visa. If you don't meet this requirement, there are alternative tourist visas available, such as a 3-month visa or a 6-month visa, which require lower bank balances.

Would you like more information on any specific option? ðŸ˜Š
There is other visa type like 2 year 1 year ?

Yes, there are other visa types for long-term stays in Thailand. 

The Non-B Visa allows you to work legally for a Thai employer and is typically valid for one year, with annual renewals possible. 

There's also the LTR Work-from-Thailand Professional Visa, which is valid for 10 years and is designed for remote workers employed by overseas companies. 

Additionally, the LTR Wealthy Global Citizen Visa is available for individuals with significant assets, also valid for 10 years. 

If you need more details about any specific visa type, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š
I need 1 year visa or 2 year not more

For a one-year visa, you can apply for a Non-B Visa, which allows you to work legally for a Thai employer. This visa can be renewed annually.

Unfortunately, there isn't a specific two-year visa option available. However, you can renew the one-year Non-B Visa each year as needed.

If you have any further questions or need assistance with the application process, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š
The tourist visa 6 month what I need for apply

To apply for a 6-month tourist visa for Thailand, you will need the following:

You must have a minimum of 40,000 THB in your bank account. 

You also need to provide a clean criminal record, and you must already be in Thailand on a valid visa or eligible to convert from a tourist visa.

The application process typically takes about one month and involves uploading documents, verification, and payment.

If you need help with the application or have more questions, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š

With a 6-month tourist visa, you will receive a 180-day stay stamp upon entry. After 180 days, you must exit Thailand and can re-enter to receive another 180-day stamp. 

You do not need to leave the country every 2 months; just leave once after the 180 days and then come back for a new stamp.

Here are the next steps for applying for the DTV Visa:

1. Gather all required documents and share them with us via the Issa Compass iPhone app or through WhatsApp/email if you're using Android.

Here are the required documents for the DTV Visa:

1. Passport biodata page
2. Photos of all Thailand entry/exit stamps
3. ID-style photo (35x45 mm, neutral expression, plain white background)
4. Proof of address in the submission country (hotel booking, rental agreement, or ID with address)
5. Bank statements for the last 6 months showing a balance of at least THB 500,000
6. Proof of address in Thailand (rental lease, hotel booking, TM30, or friend's address)

If you are a remote worker, freelancer, or self-employed, you will need to provide additional documents related to your work status.

As a British national, you can apply for the DTV (Destination Thailand Visa). Here are the key requirements:

1. You need a minimum bank balance of 500,000 THB in your name for at least six months.
2. You must provide proof of remote work, freelance work, medical treatment, or enrollment in a certified Muay Thai or Thai cooking course.

Since you own a condo in Thailand, you can show that as proof of residence. 

You must apply for the DTV outside of Thailand. You can apply from your home country or another country where you have legal residence. 

If you meet these requirements, the DTV could be a good option for you.

To apply for the DTV, follow these steps:

1. Gather required documents, including proof of your bank balance and qualifying activity.
2. Apply from outside Thailand, as you cannot apply while in the country.
3. Submit your application to the relevant Thai embassy or consulate.

The cost for the DTV application is approximately 18,000 THB if you provide your own documents. If you choose to apply through a Muay Thai or cooking school package, costs can vary from 36,900 THB to 76,000 THB depending on the package you select.

Make sure to check the specific requirements and fees at the embassy where you will apply.
Is vietnam or Indonesia the easiest ones ?

Both Vietnam and Indonesia can be good options for visa applications, but the ease of application depends on your specific situation.

In Vietnam, you can apply if you have a long-term residence permit. However, many African nationals cannot apply from Vietnam unless they meet strict conditions.

In Indonesia, you can apply if you have a KITAS or KITAP. The processing time is typically 4â€“6 weeks, and you will need to provide several documents.

If you are looking for the easiest option, Indonesia may be more straightforward if you meet the residency requirements.
No my kitas expired years ago

Since your KITAS has expired, you cannot apply for a visa from Indonesia. It is recommended that you apply from Cambodia instead. 

In Cambodia, you will need to show proof of stay, such as a visa, work, school, or entry stamps. The application process for non-residents can take 4â€“6 weeks. 

If you are Nigerian, you will also need to provide a Cambodian police certificate or a legalized NDLEA clearance. You may be asked for a return ticket, employer letter, and proof of funds.

Since you have residency permits for Spain, the UK, and Australia, you can apply for the DTV from a country in Asia, such as Cambodia. 

To apply, follow these steps:

1. Gather required documents, including proof of your residency and bank balance.
2. Apply at the Thai embassy or consulate in Cambodia.
3. Ensure you have proof of stay in Cambodia, such as a visa or entry stamps.

The application process can take 4â€“6 weeks. Make sure to check the specific requirements at the embassy where you will apply.
During the application process can i return to Thailand as a tourist though?

Yes, you can return to Thailand as a tourist while your DTV application is being processed. However, you must apply for the DTV from outside Thailand. Once your application is approved, you can return to Thailand with your new DTV visa. \n\nMake sure to have the proper entry stamps when you re-enter Thailand.

I want to apply for Thailand visa for my familys with you am asking what requirements documents needed to submit to you

To apply for a Thailand visa for your family, you will need the following documents:

1. Passport biodata page for each family member.
2. ID-style headshot photo for each family member.
3. Proof of accommodation in Thailand.
4. Hotel booking in the country where youâ€™ll apply.
5. Six months of bank statements showing a minimum balance.
6. Proof of freelance or remote work (invoices, contracts) or an enrollment letter from a certified school if applicable.
7. Birth certificates for children (apostilled and translated if needed).
8. Additional documents for children if applicable (school certificates, custody papers, adoption papers).

Children under 20 cannot apply independently and must be included as dependents in the parent's application. They will have the same visa validity as the primary applicant.
Me and my spouse can apply

You and your spouse can apply for the Thailand visa together. You can choose to apply individually or as a joint family application. 

If applying jointly, you will need a total of THB 1,000,000 in your bank account. This can be in one account or a joint account. You will also need to provide a marriage certificate and one set of qualifying activity documents.

If you choose to apply separately, each of you will need THB 500,000 in your own accounts and your own qualifying activity. 

Joint applications are generally simpler and more cost-effective.

What are the procedures for Cambodia? I am a Hong Kong citizen.

As a Hong Kong citizen applying for a visa in Cambodia, here are the procedures:

1. If you are a resident in Cambodia, provide proof of residency such as a visa, work permit, or school enrollment. The processing time is a minimum of 3 working days.

2. If you are not a resident, you may need to provide additional documents. The processing time can take longer.

3. You may be asked for a return ticket, employer letter, and proof of funds.

4. Ensure you have a minimum bank balance of THB 500,000, with six months of bank statements showing this balance.

5. If you are applying with your husband, you can apply together under the spouse quota.

If you have more questions about the application process, let us know.

How can I get Dtv 5 years multiple entry visa

To apply for the DTV (Destination Thailand Visa) with a 5-year multiple entry option, you must follow these steps:

First, ensure you meet the eligibility requirements. You need a minimum bank balance of 500,000 THB and proof of remote work, freelance activity, or enrollment in a certified Muay Thai or cooking school.

Next, gather the required documents, including your passport biodata page, ID-style photo, bank statements for the last six months, and proof of accommodation in the country where you will apply.

You must apply from outside Thailand. Recommended countries for application include your home country, Indonesia, or Vietnam. Ensure you have proof of legal residence if applying from a country that is not your home country.

Once you have all documents ready, exit Thailand and enter the submission country. After arrival, upload your documents for review and pay the necessary fees.

The processing time typically takes 7 to 14 business days after your application is submitted. Once approved, you will receive a digital visa to present at immigration when re-entering Thailand.

Make sure to comply with the visa rules, including reporting to immigration every 90 days and exiting and re-entering Thailand every 180 days to reset your stay.

If you need assistance with the application process, you can book a consultation with us.

The minimum cost for the DTV 5-year multiple entry visa is approximately 30,000 THB. This includes government fees and service fees. 

The breakdown is as follows:

- Government fees: 10,700 THB
- Visa application: 2,000 THB
- Work permit: 3,000 THB
- Visa extension: 1,900 THB
- Multiple re-entry permit: 3,800 THB
- Issa service fee: 17,337 THB
- VAT (7%): 1,963 THB

Please note that the visa must be renewed annually despite its 4-year validity.

As a Pakistani citizen currently in Thailand on a visit visa, you cannot apply for the DTV (Destination Thailand Visa) while in Thailand. You must exit Thailand and apply from another country, such as your home country or a nearby country like Cambodia or Vietnam.

To qualify for the DTV, you need to meet the following requirements:

1. Maintain a minimum bank balance of 500,000 THB.
2. Provide proof of remote work, freelancing, or enrollment in a certified Muay Thai or cooking school.

Once you exit Thailand, you can gather your documents and apply for the DTV at a Thai embassy or consulate in the country you choose.

Then after that how can I change my visit visa to work permit residence visa I have Thai partner

To change your visit visa to a work permit residence visa in Thailand, you can follow these steps:

1. Ensure you have a job offer from a Thai employer. Your employer must meet the required Thai-to-foreign employee ratio and salary requirements.

2. Gather the necessary documents, including your passport, employment certificate, educational certificates, and health certificate.

3. You can apply for a work permit and a visa extension while you are in Thailand. The process typically takes about one month.

4. You will need to upload your documents, and the Issa team will verify them. 

5. After verification, your work permit application will be processed, and you must stay in Thailand during this time.

6. Once approved, you will receive your work permit and can apply for a residence visa.

7. Remember to report your address to immigration every 90 days and renew your visa annually.

If you need assistance with the application process, you can book a consultation with us.

What do I need for a DTV
TEST8017

To apply for a DTV visa, you need the following documents:

1. Copy of your passport biodata page.
2. All Thailand entry/exit stamps in your passport (if any).
3. ID-style headshot photograph.
4. Accommodation in Thailand (like a rental lease or hotel booking).
5. Address in the country where you will be when you submit your application.
6. Proof of THB 500,000 or foreign equivalent in a bank account under your name (6 months bank statements).
7. Intended travel arrangements in and out of Thailand (flight date and flight number).

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
Can I use a foreign bank account

Yes, you can use a foreign bank account for the DTV visa application, as long as the account is in your name and shows the required balance of 500,000 THB or equivalent. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Good morning! For an extended stay in Thailand, you have a few visa options that might suit your needs:

1. The Destination Thailand Visa (DTV) allows you to stay for up to 180 days per entry, with unlimited re-entries for five years. You need to show a minimum of 500,000 THB in your bank account.

2. The LTR Wealthy Pensioner Visa is available for retirees aged 50 and above with a passive income of at least USD 80,000 per year. This visa lasts for 10 years and allows unlimited entries.

3. If you prefer a simpler option, you can consider a tourist visa, which can be extended for a longer stay but may have different requirements.

The dtv? What does this require of me?

To apply for the Destination Thailand Visa (DTV), you need to meet the following requirements:

1. Show a minimum cash balance of 500,000 THB (about 15,000 USD) in your bank account.
2. Provide proof of one of the following: remote employment, freelance work, medical appointments in Thailand, or enrollment in a certified Muay Thai or Thai cooking school.

The application process involves sharing your documents with us, and we will pre-check them. After that, you will need to pay the fee, and then you must be outside Thailand (like in Indonesia or Vietnam) while we apply for the visa on your behalf. The total cost for the DTV is 18,000 THB, which includes all fees.

Is the money required to show kept in my own bank account? Also can it be in fixed deposits, share trading account?

Yes, the funds must be in your own bank account, but they do not need to be there for six months. You can show a current balance of 500,000 THB (about 15,000 USD) and provide six months of bank statements.

You can use funds from a fixed deposit account, but it cannot be from a share trading account. The account must be a deposit, checking, or savings account. Joint accounts are acceptable if you are the primary account holder.

If you have more questions or need assistance, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š

Can you explain the retirement visa please

The retirement visa in Thailand is known as the LTR Wealthy Pensioner Visa. Here are the key details:

- **Duration**: 10 years with unlimited entries and a 5-year stay permit.
- **Eligibility**: You must be 50 years or older and have a passive income of at least USD 80,000 per year.
- **Health Insurance**: You need health insurance coverage of at least USD 50,000 or a bank deposit of USD 100,000.
- **Criminal Record**: A clean criminal record is required.
- **Investment Option**: If your income is between USD 40,000 and 79,999, you must invest USD 250,000 in Thailand.

**Benefits** include tax exemptions on foreign income, the ability to work without a separate permit, and simplified banking and property ownership.

The total cost for this visa is around 85,000 THB, which includes all fees and VAT.

If you need more information or assistance, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š
Is there another visa for over 60 years old retired not working

Yes, the LTR Wealthy Pensioner Visa is available for retirees aged 50 and above. However, there are specific requirements, including a passive income of at least USD 80,000 per year. 

If you are over 60 and not working, the LTR Wealthy Pensioner Visa is your best option. It allows for a long-term stay without the need for employment.

If you need more information or assistance, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š
I do not have a passive income of US 80,000

If you do not have a passive income of USD 80,000, you can still consider the following options:

1. **Tourist Visa**: You can apply for a 3-month tourist visa, which requires only 20,000 THB in your bank account. The cost is around 4,000 THB. Alternatively, a 6-month tourist visa requires 40,000 THB, costing about 9,000 THB.

2. **LTR Wealthy Pensioner Visa**: If your income is between USD 40,000 and 79,999, you can invest USD 250,000 in Thailand to qualify.

These options allow for extended stays without the high income requirement. If you need more information or assistance, feel free to ask! ðŸ˜Š

Each time you apply, you will need to meet the bank balance requirements and provide the necessary documentation.

Is there anything with the DTV visa that allows you to bring a spouse

Yes, you can bring your spouse with the Destination Thailand Visa (DTV). There are two options for applying:

1. **Joint Family Application**: This is recommended. You apply together, with your spouse as a dependent. You will need a combined bank balance of THB 1,000,000 (either in a joint account or the primary applicant's account) and a marriage certificate.

2. **Individual Applications**: Each spouse can apply separately, requiring THB 500,000 in their own account and their own qualifying activity.

The joint application is usually simpler and more cost-effective.
